question: During exams, my hands sweat.
When I've been taking the exam for a while, I feel stomach discomfort and the need to defecate.
When I start reading the exam, my vision blurs and I don't understand what I'm reading.
If I'm 5 minutes late for an exam, I don't go in, I hide in the school or try to leave.
The conditions where an exam takes place (too much noise, heat, cold, sunlight, etc.) affect me, increasing my nervousness.
When I finish an exam, I get a headache.
When I've been taking the exam for a while, I feel short of breath, very hot, and like I'm going to faint.
I feel nervous if the teacher stands next to me, and I can't keep answering.
I get nervous when I see the teacher with the exams before entering the classroom.
During the exam, I feel stiffness in my hands and/or arms.
Before entering the exam, I feel a knot in my stomach that disappears when I start writing.
At the beginning of the exam, as soon as I read the questions, I hand it in blank to the teacher and go back to my seat.
After the exam, I cry easily, thinking about how badly I did even though I don't know the result.
While taking the exam, I think I'm doing very badly.
I feel nervous if others start handing in the exam before I do.
I think the teacher is constantly watching me.
I tend to bite my nails or the pen during exams.
I have a strong urge to go to the bathroom during the exam.
I can't stay still while taking the exam (I move my feet, the pen, look around, check the time...).
I get sick and come up with excuses not to take an exam.
For me, it's a relief or comfort when, for any reason, an exam is postponed.
I think I won't be able to pass the exam, even if I've studied.
Before taking the exam, I think I don't remember anything and I'm going to fail.
I can't sleep the night before an exam.
I get nervous if the classroom is full of people.
I've felt dizzy and like vomiting during an exam.
Moments before taking the exam, my mouth feels dry and I find it hard to swallow.
If I sit in the front rows for the exam, my nervousness increases.
If the exam has a fixed time limit, my nervousness increases, and I do worse.
I get nervous in very large classrooms.
When I'm taking an exam, my heart beats very fast.
When entering the classroom where the exam is held, my legs shake.
I feel nervous in very small classrooms.
When a group of classmates talks about the exam before the teacher arrives, I get more nervous.
After leaving the exam, I feel like I did very badly.
I think I'm going to get nervous and forget everything.
I take a long time to decide to answer most of the questions or to turn in the exam.
An interview-style exam.
An oral exam in public.
A class presentation of a project.
A written exam with multiple-choice questions.
A written exam with open-ended questions.
A written exam requiring the development of a complete topic.
A competitive exam in front of a panel.
A general knowledge exam.
A math test or problem-solving exam.
An exam with physical or gymnastic tests.
A practical exam (typing, using a computer, completing a project, drawing, etc.).
